result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam E Lee was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
STAYED.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration or the Substance Abuse Program.
Court will fine the defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse program after serving 18 months.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Submit to and AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol, or controlled substances without a valid prescription, or no drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No contact with Planet Fitness or the victims.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

records.addlTxt: Letter from Atty Steven Hughes advising the Office of the State Public Defender no longer represents Defendant.

Case called at 3:01 PM 
Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Adam E Lee in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.  
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 1.
Counts 2, 3, 4, and 5 are dismissed and read-in.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 1
Court orders the following:
Total Prison:  3 YEARS and 6 MONTHS
Initial Confinement:  18 MONTHS
Extended Supervision:  2 YEARS

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
(Court will find the defendant eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after he serves 18 months) 
SENTENCE IS STAYED.

Term of Probation:  2 YEARS
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended
Absolute Sobriety, Random U.A.s
No Use of Possession of alcohol or controlled substances w/o valid RX, or drug paraphernalia
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessment, evaluation, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent
No contact with: Planet Fitness or the victims

COSTS:  $268.00
DR GOD SURCHARGE:  $10.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
filed by Atty. Steven Hughes

dated 04-15-2022 from Atty. Steven Hughes, requesting the case be scheduled for a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible;  
**reviewed by the court on 04-15-2022:  granted**

10:56 AM Defendant Adam E Lee in court, in custody, with attorney Steven Hughes.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Attorney Hughes is asking for a quick plea/sentencing date.  The Court will schedule this matter for a plea/sentencing date at the next date and time available and Attorney Hughes will contact the Judge's Clerk for a sooner date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
